subject: RE: [junit] written recommendation of super.setUp/tearDown ?
msgSnippet: ... No, it s *exactly* the situation in Junit
messageBody:
>> But Cedric, what happens when a subclass of SubClass needs to
>> do even more in its setUp()?
>
> Right, this is only a stop-gap measure, but it's one step
> better than the current situation.

No, it's *exactly* the situation in Junit <4, as J.B. already showed.

> - Provide a template method: setUp() / onSetUp() and
> tearDown() / onTearDown(). A bit better but still won't work
> very well for classes that extend TestCase more than two levels deep.

That's what Junit does, plus providing an empty default implementation for
the method to implement, so that you don't have to implement it if you don't
need to provide any code.

> - Let users annotate these methods instead of relying on
> their names. This is the best solution and it solves all the
> problems (and the reason why I chose it for TestNG).

As you might already know, that wasn't an available option when Junit was
originally written, and is exactly what is done in Junit 4.

Cheers, Ilja
